scenarios.question:
The responsibility to ensure the valid credentials of the UPT Sigma Tandem Examiner before the course 
begins, belongs to whom?
Have you verified that your UPT Tandem Examiner’s rating is current for the duration of the course ?
Have you read the Sigma Manual in its entirety?
Do you have a current and approved medical?
Normal drogue fall terminal velocity is?
Tandem freefall terminal velocity is?
How many seconds does it take to fall 1,000 feet at terminal velocity with a drogue ?
What is the main purpose of a drogue?

If a drogue is deployed after 20 seconds of tandem freefall, how long will it take to slow the tandem down to 
120 mph?
A packed Sigma tandem system and student harness weighs approximately?
A packed Micro Sigma tandem system and student harness weighs approximately?
What is the minimum exit weight of the Sigma Tandem System?

choices.B:
200 lbs. (90.7 kg) for VR 360 / SR 370 / 
SR 340

scenarios.question:
What is the maximum combined suspended weight for the Sigma system ? For the Micro Sigma Tandem 
system? (Specify both reserves)

choices.A:
Maximum system weight minus tandem 
instructor weight minus sigma system 
weight
choices.C:
Sigma system weight minus student 
harness weight minus tandem instructor 
weight
choices.B: Maximum system weight minus exit weight
choices.D:
Maximum system weight minus sigma 
system & student harness weight minus 
tandem instructor weight

scenarios.question: How long should the trap door effect be?
What problem is caused by a drogue center line that is too short?

choices.C: Longer than normal trap door effect
choices.B:
Slower than normal tandem terminal 
speed

scenarios.question: What problem is caused by a drogue center line that is too long?

choices.A: Drogue will not extract the bag
choices.C: Slower than normal drogue fall speed

scenarios.question: How can you tell if a drogue was cocked during packing?

choices.A: It was packed by a rigger
choices.C:
Bridle scrunched and drogue centerline 
window color
choices.B: If the safety pin is seated correctly
choices.D: If the closing loop is properly routed

scenarios.question: What might happen if you deploy a drogue which had not been cocked properly during packing?

choices.C:
Terminal velocity increases. Drogue 
should inflate within 6 -8 seconds
choices.B:
Will not create enough drag to pull safety 
pin
choices.D: It will not deploy the main

scenarios.question: What would happen if you held onto the drogue during drogue deployment?

choices.B: Open Container with Drogue Issues EP

scenarios.rationale: Holding the drogue risks wrapping/bridle entanglement.

scenarios.question:
What length should the exposed kill line be above the grommet at the base of the drogue envelope during 
drogue calibration?
How often should the drogue calibration be checked ?

What would happen if the kill line were not attached to the #5 link at the top of the main deployment bag or 
the kill line were to break during deployment?

If the kill line were NOT attached to the #5 link at the top of the main deployment bag or if it broke during deployment (the drogue would not collapse – see Q25), what are the likely negative consequences?

choices.B:
Open container with drogue issues 
malfunction

scenarios.question: Explain the negative consequences of loose student side attachment straps on exit?

choices.A:
Rocking drogue fall, student’s legs outside 
instructors

scenarios.question: What is the main reason to avoid reaching in front of a student?

choices.A: This is the appropriate response to put the student into the proper position
choices.B: The student might grab your arms

scenarios.question: Which direction should the closing pin be inserted?

choices.C: From the bottom of the container
choices.B: In the direction of the arrow on the disk

scenarios.question: What might happen if the closing pin is inserted from or pointing in the wrong direction?

choices.A: It could cause a Partial Malfunction
choices.C: It could cause a Horseshoe Malfunction
choices.B: It could cause a Total Malfunction
choices.D:
It could cause an Open Container with 
Drogue Issues Malfunction

scenarios.question: What will happen to the pull force if you pack twists into the ripcords below the pin?

choices.B: Cause a collapsed drogue in tow

scenarios.question:
What AAD unit manufacturers are authorized for the Sigma Tandem System? (In the approved tandem 
configuration or mode)
The red lanyard attached to the Sigma RSL is connected to the…
The Collins Lanyard is designed to do what?

choices.C: To act as a secondary cutaway device
choices.D:
Release non -RSL riser if the right riser 
releases prematurely

scenarios.question: What does the 17 Point Check represent?
What is the minimum exit altitude for tandem jumps after probation?
What are the leading causes for a tandem pair going unstable when leaving the aircraft?

choices.C: Improper set up, launch, fly away
choices.B: Poor presentation into the relative wind

scenarios.question: Where can you find the regulations on who may do RW with a tandem pair?
Where do you find the requirements for videographer qualifications before they can film a tandem?
When should the drogue be deployed during a stable, uneventful tandem exit?

choices.A: Within 3 seconds of leaving the aircraft

scenarios.question: Is backing out of a side door aircraft on tandem jumps allowed?
What is the minimum horizontal separation under canopy for a tandem from any other canopy ?
The responsibility for pre -flighting a UPT Tandem system belongs to?
scenarios.rationale: The TI making the jump is responsible for pre‑flighting the system.

scenarios.question: What is the proper student arm position on exit?

choices.A:
Thumbs under the main lift web, arms 
crossed
choices.B:
Thumbs under the main lift web, arms 
uncrossed
choices.D: Arms in a neutral box position

scenarios.question: What is the minimum briefing you should give any student before a tandem jump?

choices.A: Briefing on how to exit and freefall
choices.B:
Briefing items under FA R Part 105.45 OR 
in accordance with governing body’s 
tandem briefing requirements

scenarios.question: What is a negative aspect of over training a tandem student?
What is the minimum age for tandem jumping on a UPT Sigma within the United States?

Which administrative actions does uninsured United Parachute Technologies, LLC require before a 
passenger / student does a tandem jump?

choices.D:
USPA or UPT Assumption of Risk Waiver 
Video

scenarios.question: How many tandem jumps in the last 12 months must a rated instructor make to renew a tandem rating ?
scenarios.rationale: Renewal requires 25 tandem jumps in the previous 12 months.

scenarios.question:
If a Tandem Instructor (after probation) has not made a tandem jump between 181 days – 2 years, they 
must:

choices.A:
Review SOPs, EPs and 2 jumps with an 
evaluator
choices.C:
Review SOPs, EPs, 1 solo jump and 1 
tandem jump with an experience jumper 
under the supervision of an examiner
choices.B:
Review SOPs, EPs and 1 jump with an 
experienced jumper
choices.D:
Review SOPs, EPs and 2 jumps with an 
experienced jumper

scenarios.question: What additional training must a student be given if they have access to the drogue release?

choices.A:
Be given an altimeter and trained how to 
use it, 3 PRCPs with full gear on
choices.B: Where the pull handle is and how to use it
choices.D:
That they must pull 6 inches and then 
release

scenarios.question: Under what circumstances is relative work (docking) not permitted?

choices.C:
It is always permitted as long as the 
videographer only docks onto the 
passenger
choices.B:
When the student has access to the 
drogue release and has been trained how 
to use it
choices.D:
It is always permitted as long as the 
videographer only docks onto the 
instructor

scenarios.question:
What is the minimum number of tandem jumps that need to be made before using a handcam on tandem 
jumps?
Are pole camera mounts authorized for use on handcam tandem jumps?
What is the maximum degree of turn for tandem canopies at or below 500ft (150m) AGL?
scenarios.rationale: Max turn at or below 500 ft AGL is 90°.

scenarios.question: When are you to start your handles check?

choices.C: After you set drogue and check drogue
choices.B: At some point before drogue release

scenarios.question: What is the correct procedure for handles check in order of execution:

choices.C: The order is not important as long as you touch all the handles
choices.B:
Left drogue release, secondary , cutaway , 
reserve, crystal ball
choices.D: Left drogue release, right drogue release, cutaway, reserve, RSL, altitude

scenarios.question: Describe the correct aircraft emergency procedure below 1,500 ft (500m) .

choices.A:
If aircraft is stable, stay with the aircraft and follow directions from the pilot. Ensure 
the student is seated and seat belted
choices.C:
Assure the student that everything is going 
to be okay
choices.B:
If aircraft has catastrophic damage, attach as many attachment points as the 
situation will allow, starting with the upper 
left hook. Hold the student with right arm and legs if needed, exit and immediately 
deploy the reserve

scenarios.rationale: Below 1500 ft: stay with stable aircraft; catastrophic damage: attach student, exit, deploy reserve.

scenarios.question: Describe the correct aircraft emergency procedure between 1,500ft (500m) and 4000ft (1200m) .

choices.A: Attach the student, exit the aircraft and immediately deploy the reserve
choices.C: Stay in the aircraft and land with the airplane
choices.B:
Assure to the student that everything is 
going to be okay

scenarios.rationale: 1500–4000 ft: attach student, exit, immediately deploy reserve.

scenarios.question: Describe the correct aircraft emergency procedure above 4,000 ft (1,200 m).

choices.B: Stay with the aircraft and land with the airplane
choices.C: Attach the student, exit, set and inflate the drogue, then release drogue

scenarios.rationale: >4000 ft: attach student, exit, set/inflate drogue, then release to main.

scenarios.question: Describe the correct cutaway procedure for a partial malfunction.

choices.B: Remove RSL, cutaway, ensure separation, deploy reserve
choices.C: Strip the right, track and pull reserve

scenarios.rationale: Partial malfunction: cutaway → ensure riser separation → deploy reserve.

scenarios.question:
What is the correct procedure for a premature deployment of your main (horseshoe) in which you cannot 
deploy the drogue?

choices.A: Total Malfunction EP — Container closed / no main out or drogue cannot be deployed after ~2 attempts or ~10 s: DEPLOY RESERVE immediately.
choices.C: Open Container with Drogue Issues EP — Container open w/ horseshoe or drogue problems: DISCONNECT RSL → CUTAWAY → CLEAR RISERS → PULL RESERVE.
choices.B: Partial Malfunction EP — Main out but not landable: CUTAWAY → ensure separation / clear risers → DEPLOY RESERVE.
choices.D: Third Party Entanglement EP — Entanglement with another jumper/bridle that cannot be cleared quickly: TRY TO CLEAR ≤ ~10 s; if still entangled, DEPLOY RESERVE (no cutaway first).

scenarios.rationale: Container open and drogue issues are handled under the Open-Container-with-Drogue-Issues EP.

scenarios.question:
Which is the correct response to an inflated drogue (“in tow”) that does not release the main pin during a 
main canopy deployment attempt?

choices.A: Total Malfunction EP — Container closed / no main out or drogue cannot be deployed after ~2 attempts or ~10 s: DEPLOY RESERVE immediately.
choices.C: Open Container with Drogue Issues EP — Container open w/ horseshoe or drogue problems: DISCONNECT RSL → CUTAWAY → CLEAR RISERS → PULL RESERVE.
choices.B: Partial Malfunction EP — Main out but not landable: CUTAWAY → ensure separation / clear risers → DEPLOY RESERVE.
choices.D: Third Party Entanglement EP — Entanglement with another jumper/bridle that cannot be cleared quickly: TRY TO CLEAR ≤ ~10 s; if still entangled, DEPLOY RESERVE (no cutaway first).

scenarios.rationale: Inflated drogue that doesn’t pull the pin leaves the container closed → treat as Total Malfunction.

scenarios.question: What is the correct response to an uninflated drogue right after drogue set ?

choices.A:
Wait 6 -8 seconds for drogue to inflate, if it 
does not, pull drogue release
choices.C:
Wait 6 -8 seconds for drogue to inflate, if it 
does not, Partial Malfunction EP
choices.B:
Wait 6-8 seconds for drogue to inflate, if it 
does not, Total Malfunction EP
choices.D:
Dip a shoulder to get clean air into your 
burble

scenarios.rationale: If drogue does not inflate, wait ~6–8 s, then pull a drogue release.

scenarios.question: What is the correct response to a collapsed drogue in tow ?

choices.A: Total Malfunction EP — Container closed / no main out or drogue cannot be deployed after ~2 attempts or ~10 s: DEPLOY RESERVE immediately.
choices.C: Open Container with Drogue Issues EP — Container open w/ horseshoe or drogue problems: DISCONNECT RSL → CUTAWAY → CLEAR RISERS → PULL RESERVE.
choices.B: Partial Malfunction EP — Main out but not landable: CUTAWAY → ensure separation / clear risers → DEPLOY RESERVE.
choices.D: Third Party Entanglement EP — Entanglement with another jumper/bridle that cannot be cleared quickly: TRY TO CLEAR ≤ ~10 s; if still entangled, DEPLOY RESERVE (no cutaway first).

scenarios.rationale: Collapsed drogue in tow (container open) → open-container-with-drogue-issues branch.

scenarios.question: What should you do if you accidentally pull the drogue release handle before you deploy the drogue?

choices.C: Total Malfunction EP — Container closed / no main out or drogue cannot be deployed after ~2 attempts or ~10 s: DEPLOY RESERVE immediately.

scenarios.rationale: If drogue release was pulled before deploying the drogue, set the drogue.

scenarios.question:
What should you do if you can’t extract the drogue from its pouch after your second attempt within 10 
seconds after exit?

choices.A: Total Malfunction EP — Container closed / no main out or drogue cannot be deployed after ~2 attempts or ~10 s: DEPLOY RESERVE immediately.
choices.C: Open Container with Drogue Issues EP — Container open w/ horseshoe or drogue problems: DISCONNECT RSL → CUTAWAY → CLEAR RISERS → PULL RESERVE.
choices.B: Partial Malfunction EP — Main out but not landable: CUTAWAY → ensure separation / clear risers → DEPLOY RESERVE.
choices.D: Third Party Entanglement EP — Entanglement with another jumper/bridle that cannot be cleared quickly: TRY TO CLEAR ≤ ~10 s; if still entangled, DEPLOY RESERVE (no cutaway first).

scenarios.rationale: If you can’t extract the drogue after two attempts and ~10 s, go to Total Malfunction (reserve).

scenarios.question: What should you do if the bridle wraps around you or your passenger and you can’t clear it ?

choices.A: Total Malfunction EP — Container closed / no main out or drogue cannot be deployed after ~2 attempts or ~10 s: DEPLOY RESERVE immediately.
choices.C: Open Container with Drogue Issues EP — Container open w/ horseshoe or drogue problems: DISCONNECT RSL → CUTAWAY → CLEAR RISERS → PULL RESERVE.
choices.B: Partial Malfunction EP — Main out but not landable: CUTAWAY → ensure separation / clear risers → DEPLOY RESERVE.
choices.D: Third Party Entanglement EP — Entanglement with another jumper/bridle that cannot be cleared quickly: TRY TO CLEAR ≤ ~10 s; if still entangled, DEPLOY RESERVE (no cutaway first).

scenarios.rationale: Bridle wraps on you/student and cannot be cleared → treat as third-party entanglement.

scenarios.question: What is the correct response if the drogue does not release after pulling left drogue release, right drogue release, and both together? Conduct…

choices.A: Total Malfunction EP — Container closed / no main out or drogue cannot be deployed after ~2 attempts or ~10 s: DEPLOY RESERVE immediately.
choices.B: Partial Malfunction EP — Main out but not landable: CUTAWAY → ensure separation / clear risers → DEPLOY RESERVE.
choices.C: Open Container with Drogue Issues EP — Container open w/ horseshoe or drogue problems: DISCONNECT RSL → CUTAWAY → CLEAR RISERS → PULL RESERVE.
choices.D: Third Party Entanglement EP — Entanglement with another jumper/bridle that cannot be cleared quickly: TRY TO CLEAR ≤ ~10 s; if still entangled, DEPLOY RESERVE (no cutaway first).

scenarios.rationale: No release from either drogue handle → main tray won’t open → Total Malfunction.

scenarios.question: Explain the correct way to pull your reserve or cutaway handles free of their Velcro pockets.

choices.A:
Peel upward and outward, then pull 
downward

scenarios.rationale: Peel upward and outward to break Velcro, then pull downward.

scenarios.question: What would you do if your left shoulder was dislocated, and you needed to pull your reserve?

choices.A:
Pull the reserve handle using your right 
hand
choices.C:
Nothing, the AAD will activate at 2000ft 
(600m)
choices.B:
Ask the student to pull the reserve handle 
for you
choices.D:
Disconnect RSL and pull upwards using 
the RSL Lanyard to deploy the reserve

scenarios.rationale: With left shoulder dislocation, use RSL lanyard method to deploy the reserve.

scenarios.question: What is the primary cause of tandem incidents that result in a fatality ?
scenarios.rationale: Most common factor is instructor error.

scenarios.question: What is the procedure for a drogue entanglement with a solo skydiver (videographer)?

choices.A: Release RSL → Cutaway → Pull RIGHT drogue release (left if needed) → Ensure full main & riser release → Track 4–5 s for horizontal separation → Pull RESERVE
choices.B: Attempt to clear for up to ~10 s; if still entangled, deploy the RESERVE first (no cutaway)
choices.C: Cutaway only, do not deploy the reserve
choices.D: Deploy the reserve immediately while staying attached to main

scenarios.rationale: Per Sigma manual: for drogue entanglement with a solo skydiver, disconnect RSL, perform a cutaway, then pull the right-side drogue release, confirm full main/riser release, gain horizontal separation (track), and then deploy the reserve.

scenarios.question:
In an entanglement scenario where both jumpers have no good canopy and are below 3000ft (900m) , what 
should the entangled parachutists do ?

choices.C:
The higher jumper initiates cutaway first, 
followed by the lower jumper
choices.B:
The lower jumper initiates cutaway to 
increase separation
choices.D:
Both jumpers disconnect RSLs and 
attempt to climb above the other

scenarios.rationale: Below 3000 ft with no good canopies: lower jumper cuts away first to increase separation.

scenarios.question: What is the proper instructor action in a high wind landing with no ground assistance available?

choices.A: Keep toggles in both hands and run with the canopy
choices.B: Collapse the canopy by releasing one toggle and pulling the other hand-over-hand. If unsuccessful, disconnect RSL and cutaway
choices.C: Immediately pull the cutaway handle while airborne
choices.D: Disconnect the RSL and PLF with toggles in hand

scenarios.rationale: In high wind landings without ground assistance, first attempt to collapse the canopy using toggles; if that fails, disconnect RSL and cutaway.

scenarios.question: What can be done, after opening the main canopy, to make the student’s harness more comfortable?

choices.C: Have the student sit back in the harness

scenarios.rationale: Post-opening comfort: loosen chest strap, reposition leg straps, and have student sit back.

scenarios.question: The Side Lateral Connections must be detached, loosened, and reattached where ?

choices.D: There is no need to reattach anywhere

scenarios.rationale: Side laterals must be reattached onto the student harness.

scenarios.question: What is your decision altitude?
scenarios.rationale: Decision altitude ≈ 3500 ft (per SOP; configurable).

scenarios.question: What is your ‘do not cutaway below’ altitude?
scenarios.rationale: Do not cutaway below 2000 ft AGL (600 m).
